alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Lauderdale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 1:33PM CST until March 04 at 5:48AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tennessee River AT Florence affecting Colbert and Lauderdale Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River AT Florence. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.5 feet, Water covers the parking lot of the Marina at McFarland Park...with extensive flooding occurring at the soccer fields and golf course within the park. Water is also beginning to cover the road that goes underneath U.S. Highways 43 and 72 at the new playground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CST Saturday the stage was 20.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 PM CST Saturday was 20.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will gradually rise to 20.8 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then gradually fall over the next several days, eventually dropping below flood stage by Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.8 feet on 09/20/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
